fields.description:
- Login as admin to May release.
- Go to Administration -> Wiki -> Configuration -> General Configuration
- Set "Draft Save Interval" to 0 minutes 54 seconds
- Set "Maximum attachments per Upload" to 2
- Go to Default Space Content
- Set some custom content.
- Upgrade to June release

*Expected*: All settings to remain

*Actual*: 
- Draft Save Interval is set to 0 minutes 30 seconds.
- Maximum attachments per Upload is set to 5.
- Default space content is set to default.
fields.summary: Several Confluence settings are lost after upgrade from May to June release 2011

fields.description:
If you look at the default Project Role Membership for a new project, you'll see three roles: Users, with the groups set to users; Developers, with the groups set to developers, and Administrators, with no users or groups assigned by default.

Since the default project permission scheme restricts certain permissions to the Administrators role, this means that global site administrators do not have these permissions by default.

It would make more sense to add the administrators group to the Administrators role by default.
fields.summary: Projects have nobody in the Administrators role by default
License Box is displayed so TestHiddenGroupUserManagement is failing

fields.description:
When viewing an activity stream (with Streams 4), if I click on the datetime link on a review comment (in order to view the comment in the context of the review), lately (since the June upgrade) I get an HTTP 413 (Full HEAD) error, according to Chrome's Developer Tools panel.

I copied my request header (from Developer Tools) to this snippet: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/snippet/CR-STRM-885.

The Cookie header is ~2200 bytes, and the Referer header is ~1600 bytes.  I suspect other gadget-embedded links could suffer from this.  The workaround (according to my team) is to clear my Studio cookies, but I suspect some parameter in Studio or FeCru could be tweaked to solve this problem and not require our customers to clear cookies.
fields.summary: Crucible review fails to open when clicking on link from Activity Stream

fields.description: Create project (from JIRA) also creates corresponding entities (spaces, projects etc.) in all associated Studio apps. Edit project does not behave that way. The problem is that JIRA 4.4 dramatically reduces what you can set in the create project form, so now there is e.g. no way to set common project description applicable to all project entities in all apps (other than going to each app and setting the same description manually). Therefore an improvement such that edit project actually propagates to other apps is desirable!
fields.summary: Edit project should propagate changes to all Studio apps

fields.description:
After a restart/outage (long enough for the ping to timeout), elastic instances will be shut down. Users need to recreate/start a new elastic instance due to this.

As per this [KB article|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Remote+agent+does+not+restart+after+server+outage], we can avoid it by increasing the timeout, but we do not use wrapper in JIRA Studio.
fields.summary: Recovery for lost elastic instances after a Bamboo restart

fields.description:
Applications are running with {{-XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError}} on Unicorn, but no {{-XX:HeapDumpPath}} is specified - so the process attempts to write the dump to its cwd ({{/sw/java/tomcat/apache-tomcat-6.0.32}} - you can determine this with 'pwdx <pid>'). However, this path is not writable, so the dump is not saved.

We should discuss a solution with the HIT team, and maybe look into re-using / adapting the heap dump script we use on Zeus.

'mount' provides more info about which paths are writable:

{noformat}
[root@syd-gs-testing-054 bin]# mount
storage-101:/e/ro on / type nfs (rw,vers=3,rsize=1048576,wsize=1048576,hard,intr,nolock,noacl,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,addr=storage-101)
none on /dev type tmpfs (rw)
none on /etc type tmpfs (rw)
none on /var type tmpfs (rw)
none on /tmp type tmpfs (rw)
storage-101:/e/ro on /sw type nfs (rw,vers=3,rsize=1048576,wsize=1048576,hard,intr,nolock,noacl,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,addr=storage-101)
storage-101:/e/rw on /data type nfs (rw,vers=3,rsize=1048576,wsize=1048576,hard,intr,nolock,noacl,proto=tcp,timeo=600,retrans=2,sec=sys,addr=storage-101)
proc on /proc type proc (rw)
sysfs on /sys type sysfs (rw)
none on /dev/pts type devpts (rw)
none on /proc/sys/fs/binfmt_misc type binfmt_misc (rw)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Heapdumps on OOME not saved on Unicorn

fields.description:
This is reliably reproducible in Bamboo build, where lots of users are created.

Typically, this happens after a user is added using AddUser.jspa page. A 500 page is shown even though the user is created.

It can also happen during Studio plugin upgrade tasks, when the balsamiq-mockups-editors group is created.

Once this happened once, it will also happen until JIRA is restarted. Therefore, it's rated as critical.

Some failing tests are caused by this:
TestHiddenGroupUserManagement.testSwitchAccountType
TestHiddenGroupUserManagement.testPromoteCollaboratorWhenLimitIsReached
TestHiddenGroupUserManagement.testUserBrowserPage

It also happens in GAPPS mode when trying to create external users:
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JSTJRA-AGMPTEST-48/test/case/187953472
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JSTJRA-AGMPTEST-48/test/case/187953379
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JSTJRA-AGMPTEST-48/test/case/187953268

fields.description:
Seems to be that the servlet container was processing another request (http-2990-8) which led to the execution of the 500page.jsp which acquired a lock (<0x00000000f8bbb510> -org.picocontainer.defaults.SynchronizedComponentAdapter) during component retrieval from Pico and is now waiting for another lock (<0x00000000f8bd7d10>) on the same class. This lock has been acquired by the import request (http-2990-1) which is now waiting for the lock acquired by http-2990-8.

This is an intermittent issue: we've seen it only once on the local dev environment (Tomcat 6.0.20).

fields.description:
Giving commit permission to a group for a path that contains spaces will seem to work fine, but members of the group will not be able to check out/update from and/or commit to that path.

h1. How to reproduce
h2. Prerequisites
* A hosted JIRA Studio environment with a project that has a hosted Subversion repository. The project key used in these instructions will be {{TES}}
* At least one JIRA Studio group apart from the standard groups (users, developers, administrators) in the hosted JIRA Studio environment. The group name used in these instructions will be {{consultants}}.
* Some accounts (username/password) with the hosted JIRA Studio environment:
** One account that is a member of the JIRA Studio {{administrators}} group, in this text this account is referenced to as {{admin}}.
** One account that is a member of the JIRA Studio {{developers}} group, in this text this account is referenced to as {{dev}}.
** One account that is a member of the JIRA Studio {{consultants}} group, but is not a member of either the {{administrators}} group or the {{developers}} group. In this text this account is referenced to as {{cons}}.

h2. 1. Steps to reproduce expected (correct) behavior
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{dev}} check out the current {{TES}} repository contents.
# Create a new directory {{base}} in your working copy.
# In the newly created directory {{base}}, create a new directory {{WithoutSpaces}}.
# In the newly created directory {{WithoutSpaces}}, create a text file {{example.txt}}. Edit the file and add some arbitrary text. Save the file.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{dev}}: add {{base}}, {{WithoutSpaces}} and {{example.txt}} to subversion, and commit them to the subversion repository.
# In JIRA Studio, log in as {{admin}}.
# Open the administration page, by clicking on your username in the upper right corner and selecting {{Administration}}.
# Click the {{Source}} tab, to show the {{SVN Permission Manager}} page.
# Check that the {{consultants}} group has no permissions on the repository.
# In the text box below the project list, enter the repository path for the directory {{WithoutSpaces}}: {{/TES/base/WithoutSpaces}} and click the button {{Add}} next to the text box.
# On the page that opens, *Manage Permissions for Path: /TES/base/WithoutSpaces*, leave the inherited permissions as they are, and add a new permission:
## In the selection list labeled {{Permission:}} below the heading *Add Permission*, select the {{consultants}} group. 
## In the selection list next to the {{Permission:}} list, select {{Commit}} if it isn't already selected.
## Click the button {{Add}} to the right of the selection lists referenced above.
# Wait 5 minutes.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{cons}} check out the current repository contents for {{TES/base/WithoutSpaces}}.
# Create a new text file in the newly checked out working copy, next to the file {{example.txt}}, called {{other.txt}}.
# Edit the file {{other.txt}} and add some arbitrary text. Save the file.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{cons}} add {{other.txt}} to subversion and commit the file.
# Commit should be successful.

h2. 2. Steps to reproduce erroneous behavior (as described in the summary). Steps for correct behavior should have been followed.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{dev}} check out the current {{TES}} repository contents.
# In the directory {{base}} created earlier, create a new directory {{With Spaces}}.
# In the newly created directory {{With Spaces}}, create a text file {{example2.txt}}. Edit the file and add some arbitrary text. Save the file.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{dev}}: add {{With Spaces}} and {{example2.txt}} to subversion, and commit them to the subversion repository.
# In JIRA Studio, log in as {{admin}}.
# Open the administration page, by clicking on your username in the upper right corner and selecting {{Administration}}.
# Click the {{Source}} tab, to show the {{SVN Permission Manager}} page.
# Check that the {{consultants}} group has no permissions on the repository except for the permissions added when creating the case for expected correct behavior.
# In the text box below the project list, enter the repository path for the directory {{With Spaces}}: {{/TES/base/With Spaces}} and click the button {{Add}} next to the text box.
# On the page that opens, *Manage Permissions for Path: /TES/base/With Spaces*, leave the inherited permissions as they are, and add a new permission:
## In the selection list labeled {{Permission:}} below the heading *Add Permission*, select the {{consultants}} group. 
## In the selection list next to the {{Permission:}} list, select {{Commit}} if it isn't already selected.
## Click the button {{Add}} to the right of the selection lists referenced above.
# Wait 5 minutes.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{cons}} check out the current repository contents for {{TES/base/With Spaces}}. This will fail, and depending on your svn client you will experience one of two things:
## Check out fails, probably with an authorization error, or
## Your svn client asks for the password for the {{cons}} account. If you provide the password, the client asks for a username. If you provide the {{cons}} username you will be prompted for a the password. This will keep repeating, or ultimately exit without a successful check out caused by an authorization failure.

h2. Other info
h3. Same bug, different setting
It is possible to assign permissions in a way that allows users to check out and update files, but still making commits fail, probably from the same bug:
* Follow the steps above, but also assign read-only permissions to the {{consultants}} group for the {{base}} directory.
* In the second scenario, steps to reproduce erroneous behavior, checkout will be successful instead of failing. Follow the steps below to show the bug in this setup:

# Create a new text file in the newly checked out working copy, in the directory {{With Spaces}}, called {{other2.txt}}.
# Edit the file {{other2.txt}} and add some arbitrary text. Save the file.
# Using your favorite subversion client, as {{cons}} add {{other2.txt}} to subversion and commit the file.
# You might experience one of two things depending on your svn client:
## Commit fails, probably with an authorization error, or
## Your svn client asks for the password for the {{cons}} account. If you provide the password, the client asks for a username. If you provide the {{cons}} username you will be prompted for a the password. This will keep repeating, or ultimately exit without a successful commit, because of an authorization failure.

h3. Related error/bug
If you assign privileges to a group for a specific path, all inherited privileges for that path (and subdirs) are ignored: as soon as the {{consultants}} group is assigned privileges for a specific path as per instructions above, the {{dev}} user can no longer access \[files in\] that directory ({{WithoutSpaces}} in the example, or {{base}} for the "Same bug, different setting" example). The {{dev}} user should be able to access files in this directory, based on inherited {{Commit}} permission for the {{developers}} group, but you need to assign explicit privileges to the {{developers}} group to allow access.
fields.summary: SVN Permission Manager sets wrong permissions for paths that contain spaces

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com

fields.description:
As per [https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-587#c37588] I think we should execute these operations over the com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.CrowdService so that we use the same client (com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RemoteCrowdDirectory.crowdClientRef) and cache (com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory) as the host. Also it's inconsistent with com.atlassian.agmp.integration.common.crowd.impl.CrowdUserManagementCommandExecutorImpl.CrowdUserManagementCommandExecutorImpl(CrowdService) which currently (1.8.5) uses this service. We should probably remove CrowdUserManagementCommandExecutorImpl or throw it together with this service, since the only client left is com.atlassian.agmp.openid.users.mgmt.jira.UserServiceImpl.createUsers(Collection<GoogleUser>).

Don't spend more than a few hours on this; the idea is to save time in the future by having cleaner code.
fields.summary: Simplify and standardise CrowdUserManagementCommandExecutorImpl and UserServiceImpl

fields.summary: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException when searching in hosted jira studio

fields.description: The fisheye plugin is being enabled on startup (and when application state changes) which is not desirable for people who have disabled this plugin for good reason.
fields.summary: JIRA Fisheye plugin being enabled on startup

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Use Chrome
2. Sign in to StAC and go to review CR-AOD-599, which has a general comment
3. Click the cursor in the quick search box and start typing 'tim'
4. Only 't' is in the search box; 'i' and 'm' seem to be Crucible hotkeys. You can actually observe that when 'm' is pressed, the comment is toggled between read/unread.
fields.summary: Keystrokes keyed in Studio's quick search box are captured by Crucible

fields.description: !https://img.skitch.com/20110610-tmnmbir76ru4e8tcd8sdmr2nt2.jpg!
fields.summary: Quick search when in 'Reviews' return results with the only text being '...'

fields.description:
When upgrading from the May release to the June release, if a custom logo has been uploaded, JIRA hangs on upgrade.

Repro steps:
1) Install May release.
2) Upload a custom Studio logo.
3) Upgrade to June release.

JIRA hangs on this upgrade task:
{noformat}
2011-06-10 16:20:14,055 main INFO      [sal.core.upgrade.PluginUpgrader] Upgrading plugin com.atlassian.studio.theme.jira
{noformat}

Relevant part of the thread dump:
https://paste.atlassian.com/view/3545

The problem is that it is trying to retrieve the existing logo via HTTPS in order to resize it, but Studio will not respond to HTTPS requests until it is up and running, so it waits forever.
fields.summary: JIRA hangs on startup in Studio when upgrading to June release if a non-default logo is present

fields.description:
Sometimes when editing a Crucible review, the darkened screen with the spinner stays up forever.

Restarting FishEye works around the problem.
fields.summary: Editing a Crucible review sometimes results in a perpetual loading screen

fields.description: We are experiencing issues with Confluence or Balsamiq getting versions of diagrams mixed up. Although not always repeatable we are seeing cases where the displayed image (in Confluence) is correct but when you go to edit the balsamiq drawing you are presented with an old version of the drawing. This as you can imagine is a significant problem. I would suggest it's is some sort of caching issue as different users get different results when editing an image. The most persistent errors appear to be using IE as a browser but I am reckon it's more likely to be a server issue and not a client issue.
fields.summary: Balsamiq mixing up versions of a diagram

When doing a search for something like "& QA" on StAC if the result has an & in it then it becomes & in the results with the & bolded.

See screen shot.
fields.summary: Studio quick search tokening doesn't handle & character properly

fields.description:
If you do a search that has an & character in the search when the results come back the 'Search For' section at the bottom of the search results won't link to the search results page properly.

For example in JST project search for '& QA' will return several results, clicking on the "Search For '& QA'" at the bottom will result in being sent to the search page with the URI of: https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/StudioSearch.jspa?query=&%20QA

Notice the & after query= this causes the search query to be empty.
The query that is returned in the JSONP response needs to be URI encoded on the server so that clicking the 'Search For' url results in https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/StudioSearch.jspa?query=%26%20QA
fields.summary: Quick Search doesn't handle & characters correctly

fields.description: Too many threads appear to suffocate the unicorn, causing a painful death. Unicorns need to be more robust so they can vanquish these forces of pure evil.

After JIRA 4.4 is in final state, we want to move some of the plugin dependencies that Studio overrides to the final versions bundled with JIRA. At  the moment this includes:

fields.description:
Via a customer:

{quote}
Since adding Google Apps integration, we're getting a lot of reports of external users getting confused about how to log in.
* previously the first screen they'd see had a login form + forgot password + contact admin
* now they get a screen with 2 buttons- google login or "log in using your studio account"
* the wording on this screen is quite confusing eg:"If you don't have an account with <Google domain>, click below to log in..." when they do have an account, so they click the google one
{quote}
fields.summary: The wording on the Google Apps/external user login page is confusing
